column2: Job location - Churchgate Candidate Requirement- Male/Female candidates may apply Min. 5 years experience Willing to travel in and outside Mumbai Candidates with knowledge of legal matters and arbitration matters related to real estate (for example lands, properties, plots, ports & shipping etc.) will have a plus point. Worked with a Solicitor firm for a minimum of 3 years Attended City Civil, and High Court matters Roles and Responsibilities Draft various legal documents such as contracts, notices, affidavits, MOU, agreements, deeds, declarations, POA, etc. Represent the company and attend hearings in various courts. Liaise with various external lawyers and counsels. Visit offices of various Government authorities as required. Monitor and handle litigations under various laws. Execute tasks as per the direction of Management and senior-level employees. Provide legal support to various business functions and projects.  Continuously monitor changes in the laws, regulations and policies relating to business projects.  Strong command of English and Marathi (both written and verbal). Ability to interact independently with various external stakeholders. Very strong MS Office and computer skills. Strong ability to follow schedules, multitask and work within timelines. Remuneration:  This will be commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the successful candidate.   Please note this is a full-time job and No Legal retainership is allowed

Proficient in English Speaking, Writing Drafting Skills.          Competent for Legal Research, Article Writing, Judgment Briefs and Presentations.          Drafting of Petitions, Applications, Appeals, Replies, Rejoinders, with respect to IBC to be filed before Hon ble NCLT/NCLAT/High Court/Supreme Court.          Other Compliances required for conducting CIRP/Liquidation Process.          Appearances before the Hon ble Supreme Court, High Courts, NCLAT, NCLT and District Courts.            Desired Candidate Profile:            PQE 5 to 7 Years in the field of Insolvency and Corporate Laws.          Qualification Holding a Bachelors Degree in Law from a recognized University / Institute.          Good Subject Knowledge of IBC, 2016 and Company Law and other Laws.          Should have Procedural Knowledge of the CIRP and the Liquidation Process as envisaged under the IBC.          Should have prior experience in Legal Research, Article Writing, Judgment Briefs and Presentations.          Should have Working Experience in the field of Insolvency and Restructuring.          Should have Confidence and Appetite to work on a new project and should be ready to accept challenges.          Should have Administrative and Managerial Skills.          Should be proficient in Drafting of Appeals, Petitions, Applications, Replies, Rejoinders, with respect to IBC, filed before the Hon ble NCLT/NCLAT/High Courts/Supreme Court.          Appearance before the Hon ble Supreme Court, High Courts, NCLT/NCLAT and District Courts.
column11: Legal Associate, Administration, Article writing, Basic, Litigation, Legal research, Appeals, Company law, Corporate law, Analytics
